reviews.review_msg: Laurent is very passionate about the material he teaches but is terrible at teaching. He lectures as if everyone in the class has the same passion and level of comprehension of the material as he does. He does very little to structure his course in a way where you understand the concepts; instead, he only promotes memorization.

Gives 100's of pages of reading a week starting from the 18th century. Try to at least read some of it, but all? Impossible with multiple classes. Also, long assignments on complex material. He at least he tried to get excited.  Going into the final exam. Expected to have read all material. Good luck to me.. brain dead.. stopped caring...

He is an intelligent, happy, kind, fair, and enthusiastic professor. I appreciated the fact that as a political science professor he wasn't pushing a left-wing agenda on the class, and was actually rather fair to all ideas. However he does have a tendency to ramble and the lectures can begin to feel very long. Overall, I'd recommend him.

Very Knowledgeable, for his age he makes an effort to use technology in his lectures (pp/youtube...) Spends most of his time making ivory tower econ jokes to blank disinterested faces. If you show interest and do readings you will get a A+, easiest paper marker, final exam is typical poli sci exam. Do not take unless interested in Political Economy

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews.  Laurent is super  interesting.  All his class requires is memorization of the readings and regurgitation. You can pick a handful of weeks to focus on and do pretty well.  It's one of those classes where you get as much or as little as you want out of it.  No participation mark for shy people.
the absolute worst. I'm certain nobody worked harder than myself but was not rewarded fairly. As dry and boring as any human being possible. HORRIBLE!!! avoid at all costs.

A professor of political science who doesn't slant to the far left like so many others. Center-minded guy, with a lot of respect and tolerance to ideas from both sides of the political spectrum. Respectful, informative, and a clear communicator. Taken US-focused courses with him and he's not at all a US-hating ideologue like many others. Very fair.
